member.name: T:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute
member.summary: This class defines an attribute that can be applied to an action to enable querying using the OData query syntax. To avoid processing unexpected or malicious queries, use the validation settings on to validate incoming queries. For more information, visit http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=279712.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Enables a controller action to support OData query parameters.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.AllowedArithmeticOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed arithmetic operators including 'add', 'sub', 'mul', 'div', 'mod'.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.AllowedFunctions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed functions used in the $filter query. The allowed functions include the following:[list type="definition"] [item] [term]String related[/term] [description]substringof, endswith, startswith, length, indexof, substring, tolower, toupper, trim, concat e.g. ~/Customers?$filter=length(CompanyName) eq 19[/description] [/item] [item] [term]DateTime related[/term] [description]year, years, month, months, day, days, hour, hours, minute, minutes, second, seconds e.g. ~/Employees?$filter=year(BirthDate) eq 1971[/description] [/item] [item] [term]Math related[/term] [description]round, floor, ceiling[/description] [/item] [item] [term]Type related[/term] [description]isof, cast[/description] [/item] [item] [term]Collection related[/term] [description]any, all[/description] [/item] [/list]

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.AllowedLogicalOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed logical Operators such as 'eq', 'ne', 'gt', 'ge', 'lt', 'le', 'and', 'or', 'not'.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.AllowedOrderByProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a string with comma seperated list of property names. The queryable result can only be ordered by those properties defined in this list.Note, by default this string is null, which means it can be ordered by any property.For example, setting this value to null or empty string means that we allow ordering the queryable result by any properties. Setting this value to "Name" means we only allow queryable result to be ordered by Name property.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.AllowedQueryOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the query parameters that are allowed in queries. The default is all query options, including $filter, $skip, $top, $orderby, $expand, $select, $inlineCount, $format and $skiptoken.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.ApplyQuery(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions)
member.summary: Applies the query to the given IQueryable based on incoming query from uri and query settings. By default, the implementation supports $top, $skip, $orderby and $filter. Override this method to perform additional query composition of the query.
member.param: The original queryable instance from the response message.
The instance constructed based on the incoming request.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.ApplyQuery(System.Object,System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions)
member.summary: Applies the query to the given entity based on incoming query from uri and query settings.
member.returns: The new entity after the $select and $expand query has been applied to.
member.param: The original entity from the response message.
The instance constructed based on the incoming request.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.EnableConstantParameterization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether constants should be parameterized. Parameterizing constants would result in better performance with Entity framework.
member.returns: The default value is true.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.EnableQueryAttribute.EnsureStableOrdering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether query composition should alter the original query when necessary to ensure a stable sort order.
member.returns: A true value indicates the original query should be modified when necessary to guarantee a stable sort order. A false value indicates the sort order can be considered stable without modifying the query. Query providers that ensure a stable sort order should set this value to false. The default value is true.

member.name: T:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.IPropertyMapper
member.summary: The result of a $select and $expand projection is represented as an instance. That instance can be projected into an instance by calling . That method will use the function to construct an that will map the property names in that projection to the keys in the returned . The main purpose of converting an instance into an (using the method mentioned above) is to allow changing the names of the properties in the that will be used during the serialization of the $select and $expand projection by a given formatter. For example, to support custom serialization attributes of a particular formatter.

member.param: The name of the property in the represented by this instance of .

member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed arithmetic operators including 'add', 'sub', 'mul', 'div', 'mod'.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedFunctions
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed functions used in the $filter query. The allowed functions include the following: String related: substringof, endswith, startswith, length, indexof, substring, tolower, toupper, trim, concat e.g. ~/Customers?$filter=length(CompanyName) eq 19 DateTime related: year, years, month, months, day, days, hour, hours, minute, minutes, second, seconds e.g. ~/Employees?$filter=year(BirthDate) eq 1971 Math related: round, floor, ceiling Type related:isof, cast, Collection related: any, all

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedLogicalOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed logical operators such as 'eq', 'ne', 'gt', 'ge', 'lt', 'le', 'and', 'or', 'not'.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedOrderByProperties
member.summary: Gets a list of properties one can orderby the result with. Note, by default this list is empty, it means it can be ordered by any property. For example, having an empty collection means client can order the queryable result by any properties. Adding "Name" to this list means that it only allows queryable result to be ordered by Name property.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedQueryOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the query parameters that are allowed inside query. The default is all query options, including $filter, $skip, $top, $orderby, $expand, $select, $inlineCount, $format and $skiptoken.
